list.name: Bearded Jerry
list.about: Bearded Jerry is an alternate version of Jerry Smith, one of the main characters in 'Rick and Morty.' This variation features Jerry with a full beard, contrasting with his usual clean-shaven appearance. Bearded Jerry's design plays with the concept of different versions of characters within the multiverse. 'Rick and Morty' often explores alternate timelines and realities, presenting variations of familiar characters with unique traits and appearances.

list.name: Shaved Head Jerry
list.about: Shaved Head Jerry is another alternate version of Jerry Smith, but with a shaved head instead of his usual hairstyle. This variation further emphasizes the show's exploration of different iterations of characters within the multiverse. By presenting Shaved Head Jerry, 'Rick and Morty' continues to play with the idea of infinite possibilities and the diverse range of personalities and appearances that can exist across different dimensions.

list.name: Tank Top Jerry
list.about: Tank Top Jerry is yet another variant of Jerry Smith. This version of Jerry is characterized by his affinity for tank tops, which becomes his defining characteristic. The inclusion of Tank Top Jerry showcases the show's attention to detail in creating unique and exaggerated versions of familiar characters. It adds a humorous and absurd twist to Jerry's character, highlighting the series' ability to find comedy in unexpected places.

list.name: Pink Polo Shirt Jerry
list.about: Pink Polo Shirt Jerry is a distinct variant of Jerry Smith, known for his choice of attire. This version of Jerry sports a pink polo shirt, adding a touch of flamboyance to his character. The inclusion of Pink Polo Shirt Jerry demonstrates the show's playful exploration of different character designs and traits. 'Rick and Morty' often takes ordinary characters and amplifies certain aspects of their personality or appearance for comedic effect.

list.name: Jerryboree Keeper
list.about: The Jerryboree Keeper is a character associated with the 'Jerryboree' episode, in which Jerrys from different dimensions are brought together. The Jerryboree Keeper's role is to oversee and manage the Jerrys in the facility. The concept of a 'Jerryboree' itself is a satirical take on theme parks and entertainment establishments that cater to specific groups or interests. The character adds a comedic element to the episode and further explores the show's fascination with alternate versions of characters and their interactions.

list.name: Jerryboree Receptionist
list.about: The Jerryboree Receptionist is another character from the 'Jerryboree' episode, working at the entrance of the facility. The character's role is to greet and direct the Jerrys as they arrive. The inclusion of the Jerryboree Receptionist adds to the episode's theme of a controlled and monitored environment designed specifically for Jerrys. It highlights the show's ability to create intricate settings and supporting characters that enhance the storytelling and humor.

list.name: Anchor Gear
list.about: Anchor Gear is a character that appears in the 'Rick and Morty' episode involving an underwater adventure. Anchor Gear's design is inspired by deep-sea diving equipment, with a helmet and a suit reminiscent of old-fashioned diving suits. The character's appearance and name playfully combine elements of a news anchor and a diving enthusiast. This creative fusion reflects the show's ability to merge unrelated concepts to create unique and memorable characters.

list.name: Gear Cop
list.about: Gear Cop is a law enforcement officer character in 'Rick and Morty' who wears a gear-themed uniform and helmet. The character's design aligns with the show's knack for merging unrelated concepts. Gear Cop's appearance adds a humorous and visually interesting element to the law enforcement representation within the series. It showcases the creators' creativity in designing distinct characters and their commitment to incorporating imaginative and unexpected elements into the show's world.

list.name: Roy's Mum
list.about: Roy's Mum is a character featured in the 'Roy' episode, which parodies the concept of life simulation video games. Roy's Mum represents one of the characters within the game that the player can interact with. The inclusion of Roy's Mum highlights the show's ability to satirize and deconstruct popular culture phenomena. By mocking the clich√©s and dynamics of video game narratives, 'Rick and Morty' offers a humorous critique of storytelling conventions and player expectations.

list.name: Roy's Wife
list.about: Roy's Wife is another character from the 'Roy' episode, existing within the simulated reality of the game. Her role is to interact with the player and provide narrative context. As with Roy's Mum, Roy's Wife serves as a satirical take on video game character archetypes and the portrayal of female characters in gaming. Her inclusion adds depth to the episode's critique of gaming conventions and reinforces the show's ability to subvert expectations.

list.name: Roy's Son
list.about: Roy's Son is a character within the simulated game of 'Roy.' He represents one of the familial connections available for the player to explore. The inclusion of Roy's Son continues the episode's deconstruction of video game narratives and explores the impact of player choices on character relationships. It adds another layer to the episode's critique of gaming tropes and the expectations placed on players to conform to predefined paths within virtual worlds.

list.name: Simon
list.about: Simon is a character in 'Rick and Morty' who appears in the 'Meeseeks and Destroy' episode. Simon is an alien being with telepathic powers, capable of manipulating others' thoughts and perceptions. The character's abilities and design draw inspiration from psychic and mind control tropes in science fiction. Simon's presence in the episode adds an extra layer of intrigue and suspense, challenging the protagonists and creating opportunities for comedic and dramatic moments.

list.name: Vampire Master's Assistant
list.about: The Vampire Master's Assistant is a character from the 'Big Trouble in Little Sanchez' episode, featuring a vampire-themed storyline. The character serves as the assistant to the vampire master, adding an additional layer of hierarchy and complexity to the vampire world depicted in the episode. The inclusion of the Vampire Master's Assistant contributes to the episode's exploration of supernatural themes and showcases the show's ability to incorporate various mythologies and genres into its storytelling.

list.name: Arbolian Mentirososian
list.about: The Arbolian Mentirososian is a fictional alien species in 'Rick and Morty.' Their name, derived from 'arbol' (Spanish for 'tree') and 'mentirosos' (Spanish for 'liars'), hints at their deceptive nature. The Arbolian Mentirososians are known for their ability to shape-shift and deceive others, often using their appearance to gain an advantage. Their inclusion in the show adds an element of intrigue and showcases the creators' knack for creating diverse and nuanced alien species within the 'Rick and Morty' universe.

list.name: St. Gloopy Noops Nurse
list.about: The St. Gloopy Noops Nurse is a character from the 'Interdimensional Cable 2: Tempting Fate' episode, which features a series of improvised interdimensional television shows. The St. Gloopy Noops Nurse is part of a fictional show within the episode, showcasing the variety of programs available across dimensions. The character's inclusion adds to the episode's meta humor and demonstrates the show's ability to create diverse and entertaining fictional content within its own universe.

list.name: Nano Doctor
list.about: The Nano Doctor is a character introduced in the 'Anatomy Park' episode, which takes place inside a microscopic theme park. The Nano Doctor represents one of the attractions within the park, offering a humorous take on the concept of medical professionals operating at the microscopic level. The inclusion of the Nano Doctor showcases the show's ability to combine science fiction concepts with humor and parody, resulting in unique and memorable characters.

list.name: Funny Songs Presenter
list.about: The Funny Songs Presenter is a character from the 'Mortynight Run' episode, where Morty purchases an alien music talent at an intergalactic auction. The Funny Songs Presenter introduces and showcases the talents of the alien musicians in a comedic and entertaining manner. The inclusion of the Funny Songs Presenter adds to the episode's satirical take on the music industry and its various genres, highlighting the show's ability to humorously critique cultural phenomena.

list.name: Tax Attorney
list.about: The Tax Attorney is a character in 'Rick and Morty' who appears in the 'Pickle Rick' episode. The Tax Attorney represents the mundane and bureaucratic side of society, tasked with handling the paperwork and legal matters related to taxation. By including the Tax Attorney, 'Rick and Morty' takes a humorous jab at bureaucratic processes and the complexity of navigating legal systems. The character adds an element of grounded realism and provides comedic contrast to the show's fantastical elements.

list.name: Butthole Ice Cream Guy
list.about: The Butthole Ice Cream Guy is a character from the 'Total Rickall' episode, which features an invasion of parasitic alien creatures that implant false memories into the minds of the main characters. The Butthole Ice Cream Guy appears as one of the false memories, representing a quirky and absurd side character within the fabricated narrative. His inclusion adds to the episode's comedic chaos and showcases the show's ability to create bizarre and memorable one-off characters that contribute to the unpredictable nature of the series.

list.name: Traflorkian Journalist
list.about: The Traflorkian Journalist is a character from 'Rick and Morty' who represents the field of journalism within the show's universe. The inclusion of the Traflorkian Journalist reflects the series' satirical take on media and its ability to comment on contemporary issues. In the episode featuring the Traflorkian Journalist, the character's role may involve reporting on events or interviewing the main characters, providing a comedic and critical lens on the nature of journalism and its portrayal in popular culture.
